Html:
Hi i was wondering if there was a way to select Winf Fury for both hands as thats what i normally use.. but the box is grayed out..

 

also there used to be an option for selecting boss lvl now thats grayed out to...

 

any ideas?

 

Cheers.

Not sure what Enchanting shamans use - I hear that the ring enchants are ok but that Jewelcrafting is a better choice of profession. If you meant Enhancement Shaman then the box is greyed out because you'd have to have REALLY bad gear ie: <1000 spellpower buffed for WF/WF to do higher dps than WF/FT. If you have more than 1000 spellpower buffed (which is only difficult if you are still in greens) then you are really doing it very very wrong to use WF/WF. You'll be telling me next you use fast weapons.

Nope  as you can see. just my own buffs over 1200 spellpower no food buffs no flasks. all epics, in 25 man raids i put out about 3.8k dps + using wf wf and magma totem

http://eu.wowarmory.com/character-sheet.xml?r=Defias+Brotherhood&n=Moomina

virtually no diffrence as i have gone for a stacking of agi and not spell power as my rotation is SS ES LL & CL if MW is at 5.

 

i tried using more spell power and it dident seem to buff my damage at all!

the way i see it is enhancement shammys are more of a mellee class than a spellcaster.

 

the question is ,, is there anyway to ungray the boxes to check things in rawr or not?

surely its down to personal prefrence over what the bigwigs decide is "the standard"

OH DEAR!!!

You are doing something REALLY REALLY wrong with EnhSim. I loaded your char in Rawr and exported to EnhSim and it gave the following results... (even only running the sim for 1000 hrs which is way way too short btw add a 0 for at least 10,000 hrs - 20,000 is the normal suggested sim length to get rid of random number effects)

WF/WF

ie: +230 dps

How could you possibly use the same sim and get less than half the dps values? Did you run it with zero buffs? I ran it with a standard 25 man raid buffs spread.

Anyway the answer is Rawr is written to help people optimise their dps why should I write a model that would encourage dramatic dps drops? If you want to run with substandard setup fine please but don't expect that to be modelled in Rawr. The other issue is that modelling dual WF is notoriously difficult and when every run of the sim shows its bad why would I divert time and enormous effort, as its a pig to model, into something no-one will use.

BTW if you need assistance dealing with EnhSim this really isn't the forum. Contact me by PM and I'll be happy to assist and help you understand how to use the sim properly. I suspect your attachment to WF/WF comes from running the Sim wrongly as your results posting clearly demonstrates.

your completly right lol,, i bow down before you,, i have used rarw for a long time now and wondererd why i was being told by some people that wf wf is much better than wf ft  i think i need to rework it a bit more.. 

 

and yeah help with ench sim might be benificial so i can see where im going wrong:)

 

thanks for the help btw.
There is a new EnhSim project on Codeplex. http://EnhSim.codeplex.com you can start a discussion there.
